item.title: Student Health Center Provides Students with Viral Upper Respiratory Infection Guidance for Fall 2024
item.description: Viral upper respiratory infections or URIs, often known as “the common cold,” are illnesses caused by one of a variety of different pathogens, including rhinoviruses, adenoviruses, and coronaviruses like Covid-19. Rensselaer’s Student Health Center recently passed along some information about recognizing and managing URI symptoms, as well as warning signs that indicate you should schedule an appointment with the Health Center or with your primary care provider.

item.title: Webex LTI Legacy Upgraded to Webex LTI 1.3 in Blackboard
item.description: MultiMedia Services wishes to inform the campus community that Webex LTI Legacy (formerly Webex Education Connector) has been upgraded in Blackboard to the new Webex LTI 1.3 connector. item.title: Multimedia Services Announces Reauthentication Requirement for Webex
item.description: Starting on Monday, September 23, all Webex applications (desktop or mobile) will require reauthentication every 30 days. Please allow extra time when launching the application to confirm that it is properly authenticated prior to any meeting. This will improve security and ensure the software is updated.

item.title: Five Short Films to Comprise “a gift horse’s mouth” at EMPAC
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 2, 2024 7:00 PM - Join EMPAC for “a gift horse’s mouth,” featuring short films by various artists that address relationships between the body, mechanical labor, and market forces. These critical artistic accounts ask how the financialization of technical resources impacts agency over our bodies and time.

item.title: “Remembering the Stonewall Uprising – 55 Years Later” Exhibit on Display in Folsom Library
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 - Tue , October 15, 2024 (all day) - On June 28, 1969, LGBTQ+ patrons at the Stonewall Inn in New York fought back against police harassment, helping to spawn the LGBTQIA+ rights movement. To honor this event, the LGBTQ+ Task Force is proud to present an exhibit on the history of the Stonewall Uprising on the main floor of Folsom Library, using archival sources from the Stonewall National Museum, Archives, and Library to show the Uprising’s important history.
